title: NA
review: I've been on the hunt for the ideal pair of gym shorts, and I've finally found them with these women's gym shorts. These shorts have become an essential part of my workout wardrobe, and I can't say enough good things about them.First and foremost, these shorts are incredibly comfortable. The fabric is soft and stretchy, which makes them perfect for all types of workouts, from intense HIIT sessions to yoga and everything in between. They move with me, allowing for a full range of motion without any restrictions.One of the standout features for me is the moisture-wicking technology. I tend to work up a sweat during my workouts, and these shorts do an excellent job of keeping me dry and comfortable. I never have to worry about feeling sticky or uncomfortable, no matter how intense my workout gets.The fit is just right. These shorts are snug enough to stay in place during runs and squats but not so tight that they feel constricting. The waistband is comfortable and doesn't dig in, which is a huge plus. Plus, they come in various lengths and styles, so you can find the perfect fit for your body type and personal preference.I also appreciate the stylish design. These shorts look great both in the gym and for casual wear. The color options are trendy, and the quality is evident. Even after several washes, they still look as good as new.The durability of these shorts is impressive. They have held up well to frequent wear and washing, showing no signs of wear and tear. This longevity is a testament to their quality.In summary, these women's gym shorts are a fantastic addition to any workout wardrobe. They strike the perfect balance between comfort, performance, and style. I highly recommend them to anyone looking for shorts that can keep up with their active lifestyle. These shorts have truly become a game-changer in my fitness routine.

prod_name: AUROLA
title: Awesome shorts.
review: These are my favorite shorts that I own for leg workouts. They are very flattering, and the quality is top notch. I have a love-hate relationship with "butt scrunch" leggings... what I like about them is the practical aspect. This is going to sound weird lol, but its like each butt cheek is separately secured, so when you do squats, it doesn't feel like there is near as much stress being placed on the center-back seam of the material that goes over your butt. This also means that the material itself stretches less, meaning less chance of the material being see-through.I do NOT like butt scrunch leggings for the "showing off your butt" idea. I don't want that kind of attention when I go to the gym. This is precisely why I like these shorts as much as I do. They have the most discreet "butt scrunch" that I have tried. Enough to be practical and a little flattering, without giving off "LOOK AT ME" vibes. I would still only buy them in black, or a very dark color like navy, because the lighter/brighter colors would still have more of a show-off effect than what I am comfortable with.Some people are complaining about the length of the shorts. Yes, I agree that they are definitely longer than the picture makes them look, but I personally way prefer the biker short length. No rolling up or having to adjust anything mid-exercise.
date: Reviewed in Canada on 19 February 2023

prod_name: AUROLA
title: Great Quality Product

prod_name: CRZ YOGA Women's Pima Cotton Workout Crop Top Short Sleeve Running T-Shirt Casual Athletic Tee
title: Love it
review: So if you‚Äôre anything like me, you hate returning things, ESPECIALLY if you bought something online. That is why I‚Äôm writing this review. I hope it can help someone. So I am 5‚Äô6, 175lbs, bust is 38. I got a medium and I‚Äôm so glad I did. I was debating on getting the large because on the size chart it said that a size 38 bust would fit better with a large but this is not true. I do not believe that this chart is accurate. It fit well and was not tight or baggy at all. I‚Äôve seen a lot of other reviewers complain about how this shirt is too short, so I was initially very nervous to order because of this. I found that this shirt can be as short as you want it to be. If you wear high waisted leggings, no skin will be shown. If you wear low waisted leggings/pants, your stomach will show, but it is not excessive. It is just like a regular crop top, and it DEFINITELY goes past your bra (I saw a reviewer say that the top wouldn‚Äôt go past her bra). Unless you are exceptionally tall this shouldn‚Äôt be an issue. Also, if you lift your arms up to the ceiling, this shirt will rise up, but that is to be expected. This is a crop top. This is a GREAT top to wear to the gym and holds sweat very well. I‚Äôm overall very pleased with it, and this product has exceeded my expectations.Note: If you are inbetween sizes, stick with your normal size. If you want a tighter fit, size down. If you want a larger fit, size up.

prod_name: ANRABESS Women 2 Piece Outfits Sweatsuit Set 2023 Fall Oversized Half Zip Sweatshirt Wide Leg Sweatpant Lounge Set Tracksuit
title: Cozy affordable comfort!
review: I recently purchased this 2-piece set and I couldn't be happier with my purchase!  The set consists a convenient 3/4 zip top and comfortable bottoms featuring an elastic waist and a drawstring.  I must admit the drawstring is more decorative than functional.  The wide leg of the pants is just right‚Äînot overly exaggerated but wide enough to provide a stylish and relaxed look.One of the amazing features is the softness of the fabric. I've washed this set three times already, and it still looks and feels as great as it did when I first got it. The color hasn't faded, and there's been no pilling or loss of softness.Being 5'4" and 142 pounds, I opted for a medium, and it fits me perfectly. The only minor issue I encountered was that the pants were a tad long for my liking. However, a quick fix with hem tape resolved the problem, and now they're just right.  I initially purchased the navy blue set and was so impressed that I bought the apricot color a week later. I'm pleased to report that both colors are true to what's shown online.  The outfit is incredibly soft, and in my opinion, it's an excellent dupe for high-end brands.

The problem for me is that the top runs really large: I'm 5'5" 140 lbs (slightly pear-shaped) and I am absolutely swimming in the size Small top (pants fit fine): sleeves are too long and there's just so.much.fabric in general.  I was going for that cute-influencer-travel-outfit look, but this just looked sloppy on me.  So just a warning that the top runs quite large, which might be a plus for someone else!

prod_name: ANRABESS Women 2 Piece Outfits Sweatsuit Set 2023 Fall Oversized Half Zip Sweatshirt Wide Leg Sweatpant Lounge Set Tracksuit
title: Looks just like the product photo!
review: Looks just like product picture. Material feels like that type that you can find in some athletic jackets...smooth & kind of slippery. It's not too thick and overall a soft comfy material. The thick high waisted band (about 2") is a tighter elastic....it stretches, but it keeps everything in place. If you like the snatched-in look & feel you'll like it a lot. It has a drawstring that is stretchy and the aglet caps are metal which is nice. The zipper for the top is plastic...nothing fancy, but it does the job. I like that you can zip it all the way up to make it a loose mock turtleneck if you want. There is a small slit on each wrist cuff...not sure if this is so the wristband isn't too tight or it's suppose to be some kind of faux thumb hole lol. The arm & ankle lengths were just perfect.  I love the wide leg pants....not too wide & it falls nicely without bunching. I'm 5'7" & ordered a medium....I think my measurements were in between med-large. I might order a large next time to see how it fits only because I like my waist band to fit looser (my waist is 33").  Overall, I'm sure I'll wear this one lots as it's getting cooler outside. Oh, & it has pockets! yay! Hope this review was helpful :)

prod_name: CRZ YOGA Women's High Waist Dolphin Running Shorts - 3'' Mesh Liner Quick Dry Athletic Gym Workout Shorts with Zipper Pocket
title: Go get them before they sell out!
review: First of all I have tried 187 pairs of shorts from Amazon. Not really, but it feels like it!My legs are by far the area I am most self conscious about so I‚Äôm very particular. I wanted to love the BMJL shorts that has so many reviews, but alas, it was not meant to be! They are comfy, but I didn‚Äôt love them. I would be settling. The medium fit my thighs but pinched the muffin! The large fit nicely on my hips, but the thigh holes were so big it added bulkiness‚Ä¶if there‚Äôs one thing I do not need, it‚Äôs bulkiness.Enter CRZ Yoga! I have several of their leggings and they are amazing!! I also have several sports bras and tank tops that I have had for YEARS and they are still in pretty good shape. That‚Äôs impressive since I workout 5 days a week! I have tried their shorts before (5 in inseam) and they were good, but the material was heavy (does that make sense), and I didn‚Äôt know that until I tried these. Also, the large in the older version was a tad bigger, but these fit like a dream! No muffin! Thigh holes are perfect (my thighs are 23 in around at the largest part)! The material is lightweight and quick drying. These are 3 in inseam, but I also have the 4 in inseam and you can hardly tell the difference. I like both a lot. My only complaint is they go fast, even on their website.Let me summarize this way, I got a color other than black or navy. That‚Äôs a huge win for me! IYKYK

prod_name: CRZ YOGA Women's High Waist Dolphin Running Shorts - 3'' Mesh Liner Quick Dry Athletic Gym Workout Shorts with Zipper Pocket
title: Love these! Need bigger pocket
review: These are almost perfect. They are just the right height on my hips, right below my belly button.The length is perfect. I‚Äôm 5‚Äô8‚Äù and don‚Äôt like really short shorts because I have this permanent hematoma on my upper outer thigh that I‚Äôm self conscious of and also don‚Äôt like it when short athletic shorts look like underwear when you sit down because they ride up. These still ride up when sitting but not nearly as much as others.The stretch is perfect. Enough to suck my tummy in some but not enough to feel uncomfortable on my abdomen. I have chronic GI pain that‚Äôs exacerbated by too tight of clothing. These don‚Äôt cause me issues! The built in undies fit almost perfectly. Sometimes the built ins are too small and cut into me but these are great.My only con is the pocket. I bought these shorts mainly because it has a pocket. I bought a pair of athletic shorts years ago with pockets and now I can never go back to no pockets! The 1 pocket on these does not fit my iPhone 10. I can stuff it in there but 1/3 of the phone sticks out so you definitely wouldn‚Äôt be able to run with your phone in there. It‚Äôs good for keys and a small travel pill container. If the pocket was slightly bigger then these would be a 10/10.Overall, these may be my favorite or in the top 2 favorite gym shorts that I own. I will probably buy more colors unless I can find others with better pockets. For now, though, I think these are the best option out there!I‚Äôm 5‚Äô8‚Äù and 138 lbs (hourglass figure, not an athletic build, with medium sized booty, wide hips, and larger thighs) and I got a medium.

prod_name: THE GYM PEOPLE Womens High Waisted Running Shorts Quick Dry Athletic Workout Shorts with Mesh Liner Zipper Pockets
title: Awesome and secure- a great dupe!
review: Detailed review ahead (girl, be ready for a novel)‚Ä¶.I have to say first that I am a die hard lululemon fan, but I work as a choreographer every summer for a well respected theatre camp. Last year, all my lululemon running shorts and most of my tanks were on their last leg. I had heard about these online and wanted to give them a try as an alternative for summer camp, as I could spend less and buy more colors to mix and match. WOW! For the money you can‚Äôt go wrong.I purchased the white, black, denim blue, and jade green tanks and the matching mesh lined high waist running shorts. I am 5‚Äô7 and your typical smedium 32dd. I ordered medium across the board. I rapidly lose weight over the summer due to the heat and the exercise. I feel these will fit me if I fluctuate as low as about 15 pounds lighter.Tanks- These are fantastic. They are not for super high impact, but for lower/ medium impact dance they are great. I can also see myself wearing these all summer as loungewear or with shorts. If I sized down it would‚Äôve given me more cleavage than I wanted.  I may try taking in the liner a bit for more security near the end of summer when I‚Äôve dropped weight. Great lululemon dupe. Comfortable and flattering. The ONLY con I have is that the size varied slightly by color. The black and white fit more snug (which I preferred). The denim blue and Jade green fit a little looser as you can see in the side profile picture of the denim blue set.Shorts- these are great dupes as well! The back pocket completely fits my iPhone XR. The side pocket is super secure and deep. The shorts are slightly longer in the back. The high waist is pretty small and includes about an inch of tighter elastic. I personally like this for camp so my walkie doesn‚Äôt pull them down, but if you have more of a square figure it may pay to size up. The tank meets right where these shorts start. My only complaint on these is sometimes the way they lay can look a bit funky in the crotch area, but nothing too major. The colors all looked great. I wore the white with red underwear and it didn‚Äôt show through where the mesh liner was.As a set- Black is perfect and what you‚Äôd expect. The white is a CRISP white. Like, it made me pull out my teeth whitener white. It‚Äôs beautiful, but literally my Snow White OPI nail polish even looked a tad dingy in comparison. The Jade green shorts were a slightly different shade than the tank. It was not enough for my husband to notice without telling him. For some reason it looks a lot different in the photo but they‚Äôre more similar in person. The blue is a pretty darn close match. If anything, the band is slightly different due to the different material. It‚Äôs not a dealbreaker for me, as I plan to mix and match a lotFinal thoughts- I love them. I sent both my sisters the links to them, I will live in them all summer, and I will be buying more sets in a variety of colors. Lululemon who?
date: Reviewed in the United States on 28 May 2023

prod_name: THE GYM PEOPLE Womens High Waisted Running Shorts Quick Dry Athletic Workout Shorts with Mesh Liner Zipper Pockets
title: I ordered a second pair the first day I wore these!
review: I bought these shorts for running. I got tired of my bike shorts riding up into unmentionable places while running and hiking! ;)Pros: Super comfortable. 2 pockets that work for keys and phone, the larger back pocket zips to keep your phone snug and safe. On point sizing. Stays exactly where they start, with nice loose legs for freedom of movement. Which brings me to my first con..Cons: Not a huge fan of the mesh attached underwear. Due to that I cut the mesh undies out, and found out that minus them, they do ride up a bit. They still give you decent coverage, but they didn't stay in place as much without them. I had to tug them down a few times over my 3 mile run. So. If you don't like the mesh briefs, just know that cutting them out means they don't stay out the same way. Also, the ruffle below the back waistband is a bit weird. It looks really flattering if you are wearing a crop or belly button length tank. It's not bulky under a longer or looser shirt, but..why? I don't really get the concept. I do miss side pockets a bit in these, but there IS pockets available for the necessities. So that might be picky on my part!Overall? I ordered more the first day I wore them, because they are cute and comfy! I got a ton of compliments and pointed a fellow yoga lover to them because the matching mesh briefs mean all the cheeks and bits stay decent. Even during a handstand! Totally worth the price!
date: Reviewed in the United States on 23 July 2022

prod_name: THE GYM PEOPLE Womens High Waisted Running Shorts Quick Dry Athletic Workout Shorts with Mesh Liner Zipper Pockets
title: The liner is looser and these are SHORT
review: I am 5'2", 140lbs generally a Large bottom. Got these in Medium Wine Red based on reviews and intending to wear them high waisted. They do feel a bit tight around my waist (34in), and they are SHORT worn like this... I cannot imagine a taller person or long legs!! Worn high-waisted these have about a 2in inseam, and it rolls up sometimes when I've been active a while which is really annoying.The back pocket is roomy for my phone (Samsung s10) to have a snug fit and doesn't feel like it flops around when I'm active. The front pocket is on the left side and suitable for a house key or room card or lip balm or something small.The mesh is light and these are light wicking. The liner is loose.... like quite loose. If I had a Large, I would have been swimming in it. So not great if you don't want to wear undies with these!The fabric is a sporty, lightweight fabric as expected and food for watersport as well as an alternative to swim bottoms. If they get wet (red wine color) it's noticeable from sweat or other liquids. The waist band is a softer stretch fabric and feels nice against the skin and nonchafing.These are very well made and high quality shorts. The color is a true wine red and very pretty.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 18 June 2022

title: LOVE the color, but puffs a little on the sides
review: Bought these on Prime Day. Compared to other notable athletic brands, i think these are high quality for the price. The pictures aren't great to show the fit, but i wanted to show how vibrant the pink is. I LOOOOVE the color. I bought two different pairs both pink, but different shades of pink. This is the "Bright Pink" color. The other pair was "Rose Red". As some have mentioned, the waistband is pretty tight fitting. I dont mind it, but when I'm just wearing the shorts and my sports bra, it definitely cinches in at my waist, with just the slightest bit of skin bulging over. (the worlds tiniest muffin top) It doesn't bother me enough to not wear them. The other thing that makes the fit a little weird, is that while the waist is tight, the built in briefs are pretty dang loose. And i am not a pancake booty. I have some buns, and the briefs are loose on me. It causes the material where the shorts meet the waistband to give just a little puff thats not the most flattering. I'd rather it lay flatter than poofing out. Anyway, this could all be different with one size up. I'm 5'4" 127lbs and bought size small. Maybe a medium would eliminate the issues, but c'est la vie. BUY THEM!

title: High quality, true to size
review: I loved these so much I had to write a review.  I first purchased the pink shorts pictured above in medium because some reviewers said that these shorts ran small and since I wouldn't have time to exchange before an upcoming race I couldn't take a chance on them being too small.  They were a little billowy, but I kept them and loved the back pocket, which held my phone securely and the front pocket is great for a hotel key card or credit card.  I have washed and dried them and they seem very well made.  So I had to get another pair.  This time I got a size small, which is what I usually wear in most brands.  I also got a matching top in medium because I don't like to feel constricted.  I am 5-8 and 135 pounds, and athletic build.  I hope this helps people determine their size.  The top is also well made and the perfect length for me.  At 58 years old, I kind of like my crop tops a little longer.  ; )
date: Reviewed in the United States on 10 September 2023

prod_name: Champion Women's
title: Perfect elastic waist for Pregnant Moms!
review: My pregnancy shorts!!!!! I live in Southern California and there really was no way I could have survived my pregnancy by wearing anything other than these shorts. They are super breathable, have such a comfortable elastic that has grown with me thru my entire pregnancy, and really have been a life saver. I am 5'2" 140 lbs to begin with, however I packed on heavy in the hips during my pregnancy and the Large size have really stuck in there with me. They still have a nice flowy fit as seen on the model, but the elastic waist has given way to my growth. The length is nice and modest, hitting mid thigh so I don't ever feel like I am over exposed. I wear these shorts to the gym, to lounge around the house, and pair them with a comfortable tee to run errands with my husband. I loved them so much that I went ahead and ordered 3 more pairs and made them my go to staple.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 6 July 2018

review: Newest update: I washed and wore the black pair twice, the logo fell off.My updated review: I ordered three pairs. They all shipped separately. The second pair was a French Blue (size medium) and these are MUCH shorter and WAY TIGHTER than the black ones - that is because they are *not the same style of shorts* whatsoever. The third pair was a Cornflower Blue, but I canceled those because the first two pairs were blah (the first was stiff, the second was too small - and these are *supposed to be* the same Style and the same Fit, just different colors).My original review was: these shorts are not as soft as the older style of Champion shorts.

prod_name: Champion Women's
title: Good fit, comfy and colorful
review: These shorts were just what I wanted to replace a pair of mesh reversible shorts that I've owned for many years. These fit just right--not too large or too small, not too short and not too long. I always struggle to find shorts that aren't so long that they make me hot, while still keeping me modest. I think these fit the bill. They are also loose enough to move without being baggy.They are reversible, but I doubt I'll reverse them much. The inner color shows the white Champion waistband and the bottom hem is the opposite color. The inner color is a solid fabric, where the outer is the mesh with little holes. My only "complaint" is that the hula blue is really more purple than blue. Still, it's very attractive and will work fine with my t-shirts. I just ordered two more pairs.Also very pleased with quick shipping from seller.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 10 May 2013

review: I took a chance on these because there were no reviews so hopefully this helps someone else.I was legitimately sad these didn't fit me nicely!The material is super comfy, waistband wide and and fitted but not too tight, length and room in thighs was perfect to wear to work.. but the side pockets are a little narrow as if my phone (Google pixel 7 pro) would barely fit and worst of all...there is just too much room in the front crotch giving me that diaper look with every step, so I will be returning. I ordered a different pair of shorts from this same brand and same problem.But! With how easy it is to return prime orders these are definitely worth a shot for others because maybe it's just not the right brand for my body type.

review: Purchased for layering, but wanted something lightweight that would go from one season to the next.  This shirt fits the bill.  I wear it walking on cooler days and it does keep me warm.  Some wicking fabrics can feel stiff or like plastic - but not a problem here.  The fabric is smooth and comfortable.  I like my shirts on the looser side so I sized up.  For reference I'm 5'8, 150 lbs and a large fit well through the arms and gives me adequate wiggle room.  I feel like a Medium would have been too confining.  The other plus is the black doesn't appear to attract lint or pet hair, so it looks crisp and clean throughout the day.

prod_name: Hanes Women's Sport Cool Dri Performance Long Sleeve Tee
title: It fit, but it's a little cheap compared to others
review: I needed several long-sleeve white tshirts, so I bought this shirt and a similar long-sleeve white t-shirt from Cadmus here on Amazon. I wear a lot of Hanes products for casual wear, but the Cadmus looked good too, so I bought one of each. At the time, they were both about $15. However, I was really disappointed in the Hanes shirt.This shirt was light/thin and felt cheap, probably due to it's fabric. This shirt is 100% polyester, while other athletic shirts are composed of polyester and spandex. Without spandex, this shirt doesn't move or flex as easily. Also, spandex gives fabric a smoother, silkier, and thicker/heavier feel that this shirt lacks.Although it says it's for athletics, I feel like the cut and fit of this shirt are more fashion-oriented. However, even for that, I did not keep the shirt, because it didn't look nearly as good on me as the Cadmus shirt.I notice that the price on this shirt has now dropped to $10, but I think even at that price, I probably wouldn't have kept the shirt.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 30 December 2023

I'm 5'9" medium, sometimes small, but I don't believe the small would change the quality of the fit as shown in the picture. Not a big enough deal to return, but something to know!

prod_name: Hanes Women's Sport Cool Dri Performance Long Sleeve Tee
title: Very lightweight and comfortable
review: I read other reviews about how lightweight this shirt is, which is why I bought it. I need a long sleeve shirt to wear when hiking in hot weather, and this fits the bill. It's comfortable. However, you get what you pay for. The finish of the shirt is substandard at seams, but I haven't had it long enough to see how it holds up. As others have noted, because it's lightweight, undergarments may show through (I bought white). This is not an issue for my purposes. prod_name: BMJL Women's Athletic Shorts High Waisted Running Shorts Pocket Sporty Shorts Gym Elastic Workout Shorts
title: Not too bad!
review: I can understand if my review title isn‚Äôt convincing, but I‚Äôll explain. I‚Äôm someone who reads a lot of reviews before I commit, and there were some mixed ones on this item. I wanted a pair of athletic shorts that didn‚Äôt cost me $50+ and were high-waisted, so I tried these. The material is lightweight, moisture-wicking, and has decent stretch in it. I personally LOVE the seat coverage of the built-in brief. Too often, shorts with a brief liner ride up when you move and these cover like a full-coverage bottom, so no wedgie worry! Win. Some reviews said the back was too long - I disagree. I have longer legs than torso and a rounder bottom, so I loved the back length. Where I‚Äôm a little bummed.. The shorts do ride up in the front, and they will if you have a more quad-dominant leg. Because they‚Äôre a nice, longer length with a more flat front (to be more flattering, no doubt!), there‚Äôs nowhere else for the fabric to go once you start moving and walking. If I wanted to wear these shorts for a casual, athleisure outfit, the ride wouldbother me because I‚Äôd have to keep pulling them down. Since I plan to work out in them, run, play volleyball, I guess I won‚Äôt have to tug them up in front? I am 5‚Äô7, 160lbs, and I ordered a medium based on the size chart measurements. I feel this is the most appropriate size, as a L would have been too ‚Äúballoon-y‚Äù. So overall, they‚Äôre not too bad! I will probably get other pairs to rotate, just wish that the front didn‚Äôt ‚Äúpooch‚Äù out as much.

That‚Äôs the only main concern I‚Äôve ever had with lululemon, Nike, etc. my only complaints with these shorts are that the material of the actual short part are super thin paper like. It feels sweat wicking but I could still see sweat marks on them. The band is also super thick and is also made of that same sweat wicking material so it isn‚Äôt the most comfortable for long runs. prod_name: Hanes Women's Sport Cool Dri Performance Long Sleeve Tee
title: It fit, but it's a little cheap compared to others
review: I needed several long-sleeve white tshirts, so I bought this shirt and a similar long-sleeve white t-shirt from Cadmus here on Amazon. I wear a lot of Hanes products for casual wear, but the Cadmus looked good too, so I bought one of each. At the time, they were both about $15. However, I was really disappointed in the Hanes shirt.This shirt was light/thin and felt cheap, probably due to it's fabric. This shirt is 100% polyester, while other athletic shirts are composed of polyester and spandex. Without spandex, this shirt doesn't move or flex as easily. Also, spandex gives fabric a smoother, silkier, and thicker/heavier feel that this shirt lacks.Although it says it's for athletics, I feel like the cut and fit of this shirt are more fashion-oriented. However, even for that, I did not keep the shirt, because it didn't look nearly as good on me as the Cadmus shirt.I notice that the price on this shirt has now dropped to $10, but I think even at that price, I probably wouldn't have kept the shirt.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 30 December 2023

prod_name: HBassdash Women‚Äôs UPF 50+ UV Sun Protection T-Shirt Long Sleeve Fishing Hiking Performance Shirts
title: Comfort and Protection in One Stylish Package
review: I bought the Bassdash Women‚Äôs UPF 50+ T-Shirt for a hiking trip, and it‚Äôs been a wonderful addition to my outdoor wardrobe. The UPF 50+ rating is what initially drew me to this shirt, and it didn‚Äôt disappoint. It provided excellent protection from the sun without having to constantly reapply sunscreen, especially in hard-to-reach areas.The material is lightweight and breathable, which is a huge plus for outdoor activities. Despite its long sleeves, I didn‚Äôt feel overheated even under direct sunlight. The moisture-wicking property of the fabric kept me dry and comfortable throughout my hikes.What I also love about this shirt is its versatility. It‚Äôs not just for hiking; I‚Äôve worn it for fishing trips and casual outdoor outings, and it fits in perfectly in each setting. The fit is flattering yet not restrictive, offering a good balance between comfort and style.The durability of the shirt after several washes is impressive. It has retained its shape, color, and most importantly, its sun protection capability.In terms of design, it‚Äôs a nice break from the typical rugged outdoor wear. The shirt comes in various colors, providing options for those who like to add a bit of style to their outdoor gear.In conclusion, the Bassdash Women‚Äôs UPF 50+ UV Sun Protection T-Shirt is an excellent choice for anyone looking for a functional, comfortable, and stylish piece of outdoor clothing. Whether you‚Äôre into hiking, fishing, or just need a good sun-protective shirt for everyday use, this one ticks all the boxes. Highly recommended!

title: Good undershirt for scrubs, not as good wear alone shirt
review: I have ordered these shirts 3 different times over the past 2 years, both black and white, all same size. Each time something different has arrived. Initially tagless, but second two orders arrived with tags. Size of neck circumference different each time. Initially great fit and comfort. Second order neck smaller and fit higher up/tighter. Third order loose and sloppy around the neck. The overall fit of these shirts are pretty boxy and unflattering in my opinion. I wouldn't wear them as just a shirt. They are however pretty good as an undershirt, especially for under scrubs which is what I use them for. They are moisture wick, comfortable, and my scrubs slide easily with the material, no sticking or static. Inexpensive enough to replace easily when the white turns discolored from wear. I will continue to buy solely to use as an undershirt.

prod_name: Hanes Sport Women's Short Sleeve Cool DRI Performance Tee
title: I ordered a Medium and it fit perfect. Not tight to my skin
review: I ordered one for my indoor soccer games and I received it in the mail a few days ago. I am 5'3" and about 140lbs with a muscular/athletic type build. I ordered a Medium and it fit perfect. Not tight to my skin, but not too loose either. Also, the material feels like an Under Armor shirt! So if you are looking for that typical cotton tee, then you may not like this. Overall, great for the price and I'll definitely be purchasing more for the gym!
date: Reviewed in the United States on 9 April 2016

prod_name: Hanes Sport Women's Short Sleeve Cool DRI Performance Tee
title: Quality has gone downhill
review: Swap the first and second pictures around because for some reason amazon added my pictures in the wrong order when I submitted this review. I have purchased this shirt 3 times. First picture is from 2020, second picture is from 2022, and third picture is from July 2023. The first shirt was perfect. It fit right, was actually tagless like the picture shows in the listing, and the quality was good. The second shirt was okay. The fit was fine, not tagless anymore, and the quality was starting to decline. As you can see in the second picture, it's starting to get less opaque. The third and most recent shirt looks awful. The fit in the chest is tighter as well as the sleeves and the neck is wider. Again, it's not tagless anymore and the quality is abysmal. It's practically see through. I wouldn't even risk buying any of the lighter colored shirts. In the last picture, you can see the differences in color and fit. You can clearly see the third shirt is narrower at the chest, boxier looking, and has a wider neck. I regret not purchasing more in 2020. Now, I'll be returning my most recent purchase because the quality just isn't the same anymore.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 18 July 2023

prod_name: Hanes Sport Women's Short Sleeve Cool DRI Performance Tee
title: Look for a better shirt...
review: Just a shortened men's shirt... The fabric in unpleasant to skin, a simple boxy rectangular cut, no bust darts, no waist fitting, the sleeve is too short to offer proper protection. The description says UPF/UV protection but it is nowhere found on the shirt or the tags or labels. Does not wicks the moisture well and is not breathable enough for the active use. Wish I didn't cut the tags on both shirts that I ordered and could return at least the second one. The only good thing about it that the scoop neck is relatively close to the neck and does not expose much the back or the chest. I couldn't make myself to put the shirt on for the third time after dealing with it during the first two workouts...Sadly, the shirts had to go in the garbage...
date: Reviewed in Canada on 19 June 2020

review: I love lightweight breathable material for the summer heat in Florida. Lately, lightweight fabric, like nylon is very hard to find. Some synthetic fabrics don't breathe and make me very hot. I have one favorite top that I wear all the time to workout and do errands because I can't find anything that compares. Until now. This top really is lightweight and comfortable. I would like to see it offered in more light colors, a V-neck, and provide more room in the shoulder sleeves.

review: I've been hunting for a shirt that fit a ton of my picky criteria. The list was:- moisture wicking- upf rating for uv protection- short sleeves that cover 1/2 my bicep- crew neck that doesn't hug neck- white not see through- no logosThis shirt met all of those needs! If you can snag them on sale for eight a piece, it's a hell of a deal. I wear a large but sized up to an xlarge to have more room to move and hopefully less clinging to skin when sweaty. I bought white, black, and "wow pink"; the pink is much more vibrant than shown...I would call it barbie pink, which I ended up loving.

prod_name: Hanes Sport Women's Short Sleeve Cool DRI Performance Tee
title: This is perfect!
review: I purchased this shirt for kayaking.  I can get hot and sweaty under my PFD.  No issues with damp sweaty shirts when I wear this.  I love the fit of this top.  I am somewhat overweight and like that this top is roomy enough to not cling/fit tightly to where I don't want it to.  I'm tall also (5'10") so I like a shirt that comes down past my waist to fall at just above hip level, and this shirt length is perfect.  Considering the cost, I though the fabric would be thin, flimsy and prone to snags.  NOT!  The fabric has a very nice body to it, I've worn and laundered it at least a dozen times and it still looks as nice as the day I got it.  Compared to some of my other quick dry shirts that cost twice as much and more, this shirt right here is by far my favorite.  Highly recommend!

prod_name: Hanes Sport Women's Short Sleeve Cool DRI Performance Tee
title: Polyester shirts, a little stretchy: wash and dry no special instructions
review:
I bought two of these shirts, an XL light blue and later, a L navy. Following the size chart, I ordered the XL. It fits loosely, the neck is high up as shown in the model. But because of the thin material and the light color, I didn't think this shirt was the most flattering. It's fine, don't get me wrong - it isn't the fault of the shirt that any pants or wiggle/jiggles are extra visible with the light blue color. It is still fine for working out or for around the house. This also stains easily.I then ordered a darker Navy in L. This one is form fitting and because it is darker, the muffin top is less noticeable and in my opinion more flattering for hourglass figures.The material, 100% polyester, does well in the washer and dryer - very few wrinkles. Both shirts are nicely constructed in and out (it says made in Jordan). This shirt is especially good for travel when you need to pack light as this shirt can be washed, and dried overnight and does not wrinkle. It is easy, casual wear over jeans or leggings.Another Hanes shirt I really like that are 100% cotton with a more feminine fit is the
  
Hanes Women`s Nano-T√Ç¬Æ V-Neck T-Shirt, L-Deep Forest







  
  
    .
date: Reviewed in the United States on 3 July 2015

I hate sweaty cotton clinging to me and these will be a nice swap out with my basic tees for summer days when I‚Äôm outside, on dog walks, etc. I plan to get one a size down for a beach trip as a swim shirt and rash guard  for boogie boarding under that brutal Atlantic sun.

prod_name: Hanes Women's Jersey Short
title: Great everyday Mom shorts!
review: I bought 3 pair in different colors for everyday wear of Mom life and I love them. I wear 2x in most bottoms so thats what I ordered and these run very true to size. They have elastic AND a drawstring so if you're having a bloated day you can loosen them and if you are feeling thin after a day of sweating away pounds mowing your lawn in the summer heat, you can cinch 'em up. They're not too thick, not too thin, they wash well and they're super comfy. I live in shorts and tanks all summer and these are great for quick walks, grocery shopping or scrubbing your toilet....whatever the day throws at you. I don't expect them to last for years and years, but at this price point they don't need to. I plan to order more before the winter hits in case they don't carry them next summer.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 23 July 2022

title: Soft, very stretchy and moves with you.
review: This package came next day with Amazon Prime and the 3 tops were packed so well (including tissue paper in the folds) in their bag they arrived completely unwrinkled. The material has good body and hand feel.The length is long covering my entire rear and would go well over plainer leggings or yoga pants.Size XL - (each size has their own sleeve and shirt length) My bust measurement is at the upper limits on size chart 38C and broad shoulders but the shoulder seam is sitting naturally all the way out to the edge and beyond.This shirt fits clingy while feeling lighter than air on and would make a good winter layer underneath things in northern climates. There is no drape at all in the shirt, it is meant to be clingy imo or size up 1 size and defeat the 5% spandex.Colors depicted on listing are a bit off due to sheen and Heather effect, the lavender is more wine color and the peach is more light and intense melon color.For activities this is comfortable and not tight feeling but the shirt does show everything about your body contours (at my age) and the 2 lighter colors make it more obvious.

prod_name: Muzniuer Women's Long Sleeve Open Back Shirts Loose Backless Yoga Shirts Thumbhole Shirts
title: Comfortable for yoga & nice enough to wear out on the town!
review: I had a shirt like this from a popular "fast fashion" store & lost it on a vacation. I wore the style often so took to Amazon to try to find a replacement. I ordered the Black color in size Medium. I love, love love, this shirt & it's much nicer than the shirt I bought it to replace! It's super soft & the fabric has a nice mid-weight that feels like good-quality workout/lounge pieces from much more expensive stores. It's slightly slinky & stretchy, but drapes flatteringly. I much prefer it to the original shirt I lost & will order it in more colors.I am 5'8'', 135 lbs, size B bra, athletic build. I'm usually in between a Small & a Medium in most popular store sizes. I would say the Medium for this shirt runs on the larger side of Medium. If I wanted a tighter fit I would size down to a small, but I personally like the looser drapey fit of the medium. The sleeves are generously long & have nice comfortable fitting thumb holes. The length of the shirt is nice as well. I have a long torso & it looks good sitting higher on my waist with jeans and lower with leggings. After wearing the shirt all day I haven't noticed any snagging or pilling. I paired it with a strappy back sports bra & wore it to a yoga class & then afterwards to get a drink with a friend. She complimented my new purchase & was amazed when I told her where I got it & for how much!
date: Reviewed in the United States on 16 November 2019

prod_name: Muzniuer Women's Long Sleeve Open Back Shirts Loose Backless Yoga Shirts Thumbhole Shirts
title: Very Weird Fit, Not Meant for Lounging or Working Out
review: I really wanted to like this shirt! It has the open back and the thumb hole, and isn't the worst material. The fit is absolutely terrible, though. The sleeves from the thumb are way too long. It covers my pinky finger entirely. I'm on the shorter side, have pretty long fingers, and like a long sleeve. But this at least an inch or two longer than any other shirt of this kind.The stitching in the shoulder is in a weird spot as well and it pulls down at the armpit. Most tops of this type have a looser feel, but this shirt acts like it's supposed to be fitted for someone with a much larger shoulder.There's also a pretty substantial wasteband on the back of the shirt for what reason?? Backless shirts are usually comfortable and drapey. I like to throw them over sweatpants or dress them up with a cute little skirt and heels. But neither of those scenarios warrants a 2 inch thick hard piece of waistband on the back half of the shirt!I tried to figure out if I could shorten the sleeves, fix the shoulder, and remove the waistband that should have never been inserted into a shirt, and just gave up and returned it. The idea is great, but there are too many things wrong with the fit! It might work for a much taller person, but then I'd be worried that the draping wouldn't work with the giant unecessary waistband. Which might be more or an athletic fit and good for the gym, but you aren't doing anything practical with your fingers getting stuck in the way too long sleeves.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 3 April 2021

title: Works great but prior design works better for endurance sports
review: I run trails, kayak open water, and wilderness backpack 3-4 day trips. So nothing too extreme. But if a seam is rough or too raised? Ouch! The current design of these shirts adds bigger seams and along appendages that can make long days even longer. The prior cut used angles around the shoulders and flat seams on the neckline. Otherwise, it's the same quality we expect from Under Armour. It does run a bit bigger and deeper than the prior design.

prod_name: Champion Women's Mesh Short
title: Better looking than the men's version
review: I am a man who does not like baggy and long Jordan style Champion men's mesh shorts; they look awful, only useful to hide stick/chicken legs and the extra fabric is just in the way of my activities.  I have been looking for decent mesh shorts for awhile like Champion made in the 90s.  I found these at a Hanes/Champion outlet store.  I am 32 waist, thick cyclist legs, tried a small on and I love it.  The inseam is 3".  It seems that the listed women's sizing doesn't translate well to men's since the Medium a is tad big for me and according to the chart, I should be wearing a Large.  Now available on Amazon I purchased a few Smalls on sale.  The fabric is thinner than the men's version but that is not a big deal.  I hope Champion offers more lively colors of bright green, yellow, orange and purple.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 20 June 2022

title: Run small

I like to roll the band over in all my shorts so they fit lower. Because my waist is smaller a lot of shorts want to gravitate around my waist and not my hips- but I prefer them on hip. I stated with size XL which would have worked, but exchanged for a 2xl and much more comfortable and loose.

prod_name: Champion Women's Mesh Short
title: Nice
review: Stick to your normal size.. These are so comfy like wearing light boxers or more comfortable.  I have a lot of workout clothes and these are really the most comfy however I'm not sure about wearing them outside the home. Maybe a quick errond. I normally wear an XL but due to the sizing chart I ordered the XXL and there a little too big and bulky. Definitely stick to your normal size. An XL would be a perfect fit. I can still wear them right now they fit just a little lose  but if I lose 5-10 pounds I will no longer be able to wear these.. I'm 5'6 and 195. Very comfortable, even more then the champion jersey shorts. Those are comfy too.. These are light, cool and airy. I plan on using them for sun bathing, lounging at home and quick errands so it's perfect for me. I feel like I could live in these shorts as there so comfortable.Update: I ordered these in pink the XL and the fit is much better but still comfortable. These are extremely stretchy... Again for reference  I'm 5'6 195 and the XL is a perfect fit but I could wear a large too. The elastic is extremely stretchy and workable.. The XXL I previously ordered fits but just barely, they are lose and they are so comfy I sleep in them.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 7 April 2018

title: I love these pants!
review: For reference, I am 5'1" and 105-110 pounds. I have three pairs of these now, in both small and medium. I got the medium first and should have gotten the other two in medium as well.The small definitely fits, and they aren't uncomfortable. They just sit higher than I like (above my bellybutton), and that makes the pockets weirdly high on my hips. The legs aren't tight, and the length is good.The medium sits at my hips and the legs are nicely baggy but not overly so. They are a little longer, but since these are cuffed it isn't really an issue.So if you want a more fitted pant, get your normal size. If you want some bagginess, go a size up. Otherwise these are great. Super soft and comfy, great lounging around pants. Thin enough for warmer weather but not too thin to wear on colder days. Highly recommend!

title: I love these so much that I bought more! (Colors and sizing are issues, though)
review: These are SO cute and comfy!! I initially only ordered one pair, but I liked them so much that I ordered another two pairs!In terms of colors, however... The green is a much lighter shade compared to the deep emerald depicted in the listing. Also, like some other reviewers, I'm not sure if they sent me the pink instead of purple, or if that's genuinely the color of the "purple" (but since these are just loungewear for home, I'm not really bothered). The grey blue is pretty spot on, though.Keep in mind that these DEFINITELY run small - I'm normally a medium/large-ish in USA women's (5'3" and roughly ~150lbs), but I ordered these in XL and I feel like they fit appropriately (slightly baggy). I do have to roll up the bottoms 2 times, but that's super easy because of the elastic.All in all, if you're not too worried about the exact color, I think these are a great option for comfy lounge joggers.

I'm 5'10" and it's incredibly difficult to find women's workout shorts that aren't leggings and have an inseam greater than 2", but are still shorts.I have heat and exercise induced urticaria (hives), so I can't wear tight fitting clothing, such a leggings, while exercising.These shorts are comfortable and breathable with deep pockets and adjustable draw string. The length is perfect.My only note about these is the sizing. I'm 5'10" 145lbs. I bought a medium and they fit, but the waist band was a little snug and I didn't like how the scrunched band felt around my waist. For that reason, I sized up to a large. They have a little too much room in the waist but I'd much prefer to tie them closed than to feel like they are too tight. If you are sensitive to snug clothing, you may want to size up for the waist.Overall, these are my favorite workout shorts. The only change I would make to them would be zippered pockets.

title: G√ºnstige Sportkleidung f√ºr kleine Gr√∂√üen ~~~ Affordable sports outfit for smaller sizes
review: Das Set habe ich mir bereits vor einigen Monaten gekauft jedoch aufgrund zwischenzeitlicher leichter Gewichtsabnahme erst jetzt testen k√∂nnen. Zuvor sa√ü es einfach zu stramm.Passform: Es ist zu merken, dass die Passform eher an kleine Gr√∂√üen angelehnt ist. Wer nicht komplett schmal gebaut ist kommt hier schnell an die eigenen Grenzen oder kommt einfach nicht in alle Einzelteile hinein. Das Bustier ist recht gro√üz√ºgig gearbeitet (bis Cup-Gr√∂√üe B/C). Darin sind seitlich herausnehmbare Schaumstoffeinlagen vorhanden sowie breite Tr√§ger sodass kein zus√§tzlicher Halt erforderlich ist.Die Kurz-Jacke gef√§llt mir sehr gut und kann alternativ mit anderer Freizeitkleidung wie z.B. Jeans kombiniert werden.F√ºr die Hose ist wiederum eine schmale K√∂rperform erforderlich. Die Streifen unter dem Po sitzen jedoch 10cm weiter unten als angedacht.Selbst die L-Gr√∂√üe wird oberhalb von 65 kg schon √§u√üerst anschmiegsam es gilt also die Gr√∂√üentabelle dringend zu beachten und nicht nach der eigenen Standard-Kleidergr√∂√üe zu gehen.Kompression: die Kleidung sitzt schon sehr eng am K√∂rper gibt noch etwas nach beim Anziehen. Daf√ºr wackelt nicht so viel und der St√ºtzeffekt ist gegeben.Stoffqualit√§t und Verarbeitung: Sicherlich muss man nicht gro√ü √ºber Nachhaltigkeit bei diesem Preis diskutieren. Dennoch ist ein Gro√üteil konventioneller Sportkleidung aus Kunstfasern hergestellt. Der Vergleich mit √∂kologisch hergestellter Funktionskleidung ist demnach eher schwierig.Die Verarbeitung erscheint soweit solide jedoch habe ich die Teile per Hand und nicht in der Maschine vorgewaschen. Es ist vorstellbar, dass aufgrund der unterschiedlichen Stoffmuster und teils 3D-Struktur schnell Besch√§digungen auftreten k√∂nnen. Insgesamt ist der Stoff dick (daher auch in der k√ºhleren Jahreszeit drau√üen tragbar), dadurch schwitzt man eben auch etwas schneller.Farbe: Die Farbe hier Rosa/Lila ist wie erwartet und sieht sportlich-modern aus. Gef√§llt mir gut.Gesamteindruck: Aus meiner Sicht ist das Set eher f√ºr die j√ºngere Generation gedacht, teils auch noch mit 30-40 Jahren noch tragbar (je nach Farbwahl). Der Look ist sportlich aber wie gesagt muss eine gewisse Trainingsform/Fitness vorhanden sein sonst tr√§gt es zu sehr auf und sieht seltsam aus.F√ºr den Preis dennoch viel Ware f√ºr wenig Geld wobei eben nicht die nachhaltigste Wahl. Aufgrund der positiven Aspekte gebe ich 4 von 5 Sternen.~~~EnglishTo begin with: I bought the set a few months ago but couldn't wear it until recently due to slight weight loss. Before it was way too tight.Fit: It is to mention that the sizes relate to smaller sizes. When you're not completley slim you will easily have problems getting on the pieces or you won't fit into every single one of them. The bra is a little more spacious (up to cup B or C). Therein you find removable inlays made of foam. In addition the top has wide straps so you don't need additional support.The short jacket is very nice and can be combined with other sorts of causal clothing like jeans.In order to fit into the pants a slim body is recommended However, the stripes below the back are 5 inches lower than expected. Even the large size fits extremely tight above 65 kilogram so it is very important to take the size chart into account instead of choosing your own usual size.Compression: the clothes fit very tight to the body but is also stretchy while putting on. Therefore it is not too boundy and there is enough support, too.Quality and tailoring: Of course you can't discuss sustainability at this price point. Nonetheless the majority of conventional sports clothing is made of synthetic fibers.The comparision to ecologically fabricated functional clothing therefore is very difficult. The tailoring seems solid to me but I also pre-washed the pieces by hand and not in the washing machine. Maybe the tissue can be damaged easily due to the 3D-structure and the different patterns. In total the fabric is thick so you can wear it outside even during the cold seasons. Besides you also sweat more quickly.Colour: The colour pink/lilac is as expected and looks sporty and modern which I like very much.Overall impression: In my opinion the set is more suitable for the younger generation partly maybe also wearable in your 30s and 40s (depending on the colour choice). The look is athletic but you need to possess a certain form or fitness. Otherwise it comes out not too flattering and looks peculiar.Regarding the price you get a lot of product for your money while not picking the most sustainable choice. Due to the positive points I give the set 4 out of 5 stars.

title: Love the jacket, I have two, but...
review: Great jacket - well fitted and a great cut that is longer in the back and not cropped (seriously, not everyone likes a cropped jacket - we sixty-year-olds actually DO go to the gym, lift, and run, but it doesn't mean we like everything skin-tight and cropped), but size up if you don't want the skin-tight fit. Great quality. The blue is beautiful.Had to take off stars because the first I ordered was perfect, but the second I ordered was in a sealed package, but smelled of perfume and the tags were cut out. OBVIOUSLY a worn and returned garment. Since they have no more in my size, I will keep it and wash it, but I'm not happy about it.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 25 October 2023

The outside pockets have zippers but there are no inside pockets. This definitely runs small. I purchased a large according to their size chat and it‚Äôs small. I can zip it. But it‚Äôs tight. I am 5‚Äô9‚Äù tall and weigh 147 pounds.  I would like to own this lightweight jacket in all the available colors, and would definitely recommend it to friends.

prod_name: C9 Champion Women's Full Zip Cardio Jacket
title: Fitting
review: My wingspan (fingertip-to-fingertip length) is an 1" longer than my height. That kind of physiology is great for swimming or boxing, but it's terrible for wearing full-sleeve tops because regular-cut apparel will end above my wrist bone. It's like wearing "flood-style pants" on my arms.Thumbhole garments are an answer to this fit and fashion problem since the arm fabric is designed to be longer in order to encircle the thumb and upper part of the wrist and hand in a sort of half hand-glove fit. With my monkey-length arms, I still can't use the thumbholes without stretching the fabric, but worn as a regular garment, the sleeve length and wrist cuff lay long and flat - like proportional people's - right below my wrist. I also love the tapered waist, the zipped pockets, the high collar and the darts/accents just above the bosom. I bought two jackets - one in black and one in purple. They have become my go-to casual outfit.Now, if only I can find other casual and formal wear with this kind of design length, I'll be all set.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 13 March 2022

prod_name: C9 Champion Women's Full Zip Cardio Jacket

review: Comfortable, fits great, perfect weight for a cool morning!

title: ran really small

The collar also stood up too high and hit my chin BUT if I wanted a workout or casual jacket like I said I would have exchanged for a size larger - it just wasnt what I wanted to leave in a casual office to wear when the AC was on too high. The cut was surprisingly flattering and had shape.

prod_name: C9 Champion Women's Full Zip Cardio Jacket
title: Nice jacket - runs a tad small
review: Well made, no loose threads or problems with zippers and seams. I like the intermediate weight. The dark purple is a great color. Pockets deep enough for most phones. The sleeves are long enough to be comfortable working out or running. The back length is good - not too short, not too long - and comes to maybe 5" or so below waist,  to keep out cold air. I like the thumb holes - keeps the sleeves where they should be. I can wear gloves without interference because they fit over the cuff. I took off one star because the cut seems a hair too tight in the armholes and across the bust. I am 5-6", 143 lbs, average build.  The XL would be too big, and def too long in the arms. However, I still like the jacket. It is mid-weight and good for cool weather. A long-sleeved top makes it that tad too tight. If you do layer, the underlayer needs to be form-fitting or sleeveless.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 15 November 2020

It's very form-fitting, which would be fine if I could get a heavy T-shirt under it without leaving unflattering bulges. This works fine over a sports bra or maybe a thin (sleeveless) workout shirt. I could size up to a medium and be OK over a T-shirt, but I was really hoping for something that I could throw on as a jacket during cool (but not COLD temps). This jacket really isn't heavy enough for that. It's going back, and the search continues. Really sad because I used to love this C9 line...

prod_name: C9 Champion Women's Woven Training Pants
title: Not the Same Quality
review: I've purchased, loved and worn the "C9 Champion Womens Woven Training Track Pants" for many years because of their durability, comfort and large mid-thigh front zip pocket. Originally, I bought these in several colors from another store, but Champion stopped selling them for 2 or 3 years. So I was delighted to search and find the same named pants here at Amazon. These latest pants I purchased (1) stank strongly of an unpleasant chemical when I opened their plastic bag; (it took 3 washes to eliminate this odor); (2) has a cheap zipper that I doubt will last very long with ordinary use; and (3) has a much thinner, less durable fabric construction that I accidentally poked a hole thru with my finger!! Lastly, the fabric is beginning to discolor, despite being cold washed gently with similar colors using Free and Clear, dried for just 10 minutes on Low and then hung to finish drying. Very sad ... Poor follow-up, Champion.
date: Reviewed in the United States on 24 November 2023
